text: Brendan Emmet Irvine (born 17 May 1996), nicknamed the "Wee Rooster", is an Irish amateur boxer from Belfast. He won a silver medal in the men's 49 kg division at the 2015 European Games, becoming the first ever medalist for Ireland at the Games. He moved up to the 52 kg weight class in 2016, winning another Irish senior title and also competing at the 2016 Olympic Games in Rio. In 2017 Irvine won another major medal for Ireland for the European championships finishing in top 3 taking away a bronze medal. The next year he went in to the CWG in the Gold Coast Australia bagging another sliver medal for NI. Inactive for 2019 with a few injury’s he came back hungry as ever and qualified for the 2020 Olympic Games in Tokyo beating a tricky boxer from Hungary in the Europeans Olympic qualifier taking him to the top 8 spot. ==References== ==External links== * * * * * Category:Living people Category:1996 births Category:Sportspeople from Belfast Category:Male boxers from Northern Ireland Category:Irish male boxers Category:Boxers at the 2015 European Games Category:European Games competitors for Ireland Category:European Games silver medalists for Ireland Category:European Games medalists in boxing Category:Boxers at the 2016 Summer Olympics Category:Olympic boxers of Ireland Category:Commonwealth Games medallists in boxing Category:Commonwealth Games silver medallists for Northern Ireland Category:Boxers at the 2018 Commonwealth Games Category:Flyweight boxers
